title: Flipped Learning-Based Social Issue-Solving Project

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary-level social studies core concepts and problem-solving process comprehension
context.additional_context: Conducted in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, emphasizing collaborative problem-solving activities centered on social issues

learning_goals: Achieve over 80% participation in defining social issues based on pre-provided materials in a flipped learning environment
Revise and improve problem-solving solutions at least three times incorporating peer evaluation and feedback using interactive problem-posing strategies
Meet at least four of the five formative assessment criteria (problem recognition-analysis-hypothesis setting-solution development-evaluation) established to enhance problem-posing abilities

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
